title: This deal doesn't get Brexit done - it's just the end of the beginning
text:
Boris Johnson is an avid student of Winston Churchill, so he will well know the great statesman’s speech after the Allies’ victory at El Alamein in 1942. “This is not the end. It is not even the beginning of the end. But it is, perhaps, the end of the beginning,” he warned.

The prime minister's use of wartime rhetoric has landed him in trouble with his political opponents lately, but it is difficult to think of a more fitting comparison now that the UK has finally struck a deal.

Let’s praise Johnson for doing in three months what his predecessor couldn’t manage in three years - assuming he can get it through the House of Commons. But anybody thinking we’ve finally "got Brexit done", in the phrase...
description: Boris Johnson is an avid student of Winston Churchill, so he will well know the great statesman’s speech after the Allies’ victory at El Alamein in 1942.
